definition: sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
day/sky/heaven
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: To hit this nowhere zilch town, and you can't?
sentences.chinese: 足以让这个小镇翻天覆地而你却不能去？

sentences.english: The last two decades has witnessed earth-shaking changes in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国在过去的二十年中发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: Such an earthshaking change must have far-reaching effects.
sentences.chinese: 像这样翻天覆地的变化一定会产生深远的影响。

sentences.english: Your earth-shaking changes have taken place.
sentences.chinese: 你发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: As long as a good grasp of the opportunity, absolutely can make great cause.
sentences.chinese: 只要把握好了机会，绝对能做出翻天覆地的大事业。

sentences.english: Yeah ,dramatic changes took place in the big family in hundred years .
sentences.chinese: 是的，这个大家庭在百年里发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: Indeed, change in Indonesia over the past 20 years has been breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 的确，印尼在过去20年发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: But also recognize that this is not what's going to change the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 而是要认识到，这些做法并不会带来翻天覆地的变革。

sentences.english: Until runs into Carter, Will's life has only then had the earth-shaking change.
sentences.chinese: 直到遇到卡特，威尔的生活才发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: The human environment of Guangdong has occupied the earth-shaking change since the Reform and Open Policy.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以来广东人居环境发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: In recent years, Shanghai has experienced world-shaking changes.
sentences.chinese: 近几年来上海发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: Along with the development of the Chinese economy, China has undergone enormous changes.
sentences.chinese: 随着经济的发展，中国的面貌发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: Kurosaki a protection from all things around us are tremendous.
sentences.chinese: 从此黑崎一护身边所有的事物都翻天覆地。

sentences.english: Since then, Liu Xintong life has undergone earth-shaking changes.
sentences.chinese: 自此，刘欣桐的生活发生了翻天覆地的变化。

sentences.english: "Life will change forever," she says after the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: “生活就此翻天覆地，”仪式结束后她这样说。

sentences.english: Over the past 28 years earthshaking changes have taken place in China.
sentences.chinese: 28年来，中国的面貌发生了翻天覆地的变化。

definition: sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
great changes
to change dramatically/radical change
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion
things are very different now (idiom)/times have changed
world-shaking (idiom)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
changeable situation (idiom)
heaven falls and earth rends (idiom); rocked by a major disaster/fig. violent revolution/major social upheaval
changes/vicissitudes
bold and decisive
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
unprecedented in history
daily renewal, monthly change (idiom)/every day sees new developments/rapid progress
lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
